intro: Lespedeza jiangxiensis, commonly known as Jiangxi lespeadeza, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Jiangxi province. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, making it an ornamental plant in some regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
